Description:
The job duties of a dental assistant generally include the following:Prepare treatment rooms for patient examinations and procedures, including sterilizing instruments and ensuring that all necessary supplies and equipment are available.
Assist the dentist during dental procedures, including passing instruments, suctioning oral fluids, and providing other support as needed.
Take and develop dental x-rays as ordered by the dentist.
Perform basic laboratory procedures, such as preparing dental impressions and pouring and trimming models.
Provide patient education on proper oral hygiene techniques, including brushing and flossing.
Schedule patient appointments and maintain patient records.
Manage inventory of dental supplies and equipment, and order as needed.
Perform basic administrative tasks, such as answering phones and filing paperwork. In addition to these basic duties, dental assistants will also be responsible for managing infection control procedures, maintaining dental equipment, and assisting with dental billing and insurance claims.
Perform other projects or duties as assigned.Skills
Skills: Education and Licensure: Minimum of Diploma degree in Dental Assistant program from accredited National/International University or College.
Professional experience: Preferred with at least 1 year experience in same field.

Demonstrated Clinical Dental Abilities.
Problem Solving and Organizational Skills.
Very good oral and written Communication Skills.
Ability to work effectively as part of a team.
Good Interpersonal Skills.
Computer Literate.
English and Arabic Capability.
Flexible, Adaptable and Energetic.

Preferred.Residence Location: Jeddah , Saudi Arabia ; Riyadh, Saudi Arabia
